content: Stocks Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 14 Mar 2019Who gets paid first in insolvency? Creditors or Shareholders?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Sandra TeoLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 14 Mar 2019The order of precedence is secured creditors, unsecured creditors, preffered shareholders and coming in last common shareholders. In most cases, there isn't much left for common shareholders by the time the corporation has paid off other obligations.0 comments0
